lint-python3: 1 file would be reformatted¬∂

‚Äú1 file would be reformatted‚Äù after running Black, it means that the specified file doesn‚Äôt conform to Black‚Äôs formatting standards and would be changed if you ran Black without the ‚Äìcheck flag.

$ isort . --check-only --profile black --skip venv
Skipped 1 files
$ black --check . --exclude=venv
would reformat /builds/elxr/tools/tiler/tiler/iso.py
Oh no! üí• üíî üí•
1 file would be reformatted, 24 files would be left unchanged.
Cleaning up project directory and file based variables 00:00
ERROR: Job failed: exit code 1

Here‚Äôs what this means:

Black found formatting issues: Black analyzed your code and identified areas that don‚Äôt match its style guide. No changes were made: The ‚Äìcheck flag tells Black to only report potential formatting changes without actually modifying the file. To reformat: If you want Black to automatically reformat the file, run it again without the ‚Äìcheck flag:

root@e9c62ac0960e:/usr/src/tiler2# black --check .
would reformat /usr/src/tiler2/tiler/iso.py

Oh no! üí• üíî üí•
1 file would be reformatted, 24 files would be left unchanged.
root@e9c62ac0960e:/usr/src/tiler2# black /usr/src/tiler2/tiler/iso.py
reformatted /usr/src/tiler2/tiler/iso.py

All done! ‚ú® üç∞ ‚ú®
1 file reformatted.
root@e9c62ac0960e:/usr/src/tiler2# black --check .
All done! ‚ú® üç∞ ‚ú®
25 files would be left unchanged.

hliu4@pek-lpd-susbld:tiler2$git diff tiler/iso.py
